scenario: Donald Trump and Arty are sitting in a lecture hall at the WARA Summer School, listening to presentations. The screen shows examples of last year's student work.

dialogue.line: I've got to say, this is not impressive. They could be spending this money on something much more tremendous, believe me.
Well, it's an academic setting. The point is to explore and learn, not necessarily to be 'tremendous'.

scenario: Zenodia Charpy from NVIDIA starts presenting about multi-model technologies.

dialogue.line: This NVIDIA stuff is pretty cool. They're working on some groundbreaking technology.
Groundbreaking? Maybe for a toy company.

scenario: Announcement about the group project where students will work in groups to create a short story told by 3D avatars.

dialogue.line: The group project seems like a great way to put what we've learned into practice.
A group project? I don't do groups. I lead. Big difference.

scenario: The day wraps up, and everyone is heading out of the lecture hall.

dialogue.line: Well, that was a complete waste of my time.
I don't know, I found it to be quite informative. But to each their own, I guess.
